def.dt: :a unit of money that is equal to 1/100 of the basic unit of money in many countries :one percent of a dollar, euro, rupee, etc. A dime is worth 10 cents. The car isn't worth a cent. [=the car is not worth anything]
:no money at all I would not pay one red cent for that car. [=I would not pay any money at all for that car]

:someone's opinion about something He's always ready to offer his two cents on any topic, whether he knows anything about it or not. Can I put/throw in my two cents? [=can I give my opinion?] If I can, I'd like to offer my two cents' worth. [=my opinion]

:one part in a hundred :an amount that is equal to one one-hundredth of something The value has increased half a percent. several percent usually used with a number Thirty percent [=3/10] of the class failed the test. Water covers more than 70 percent of the Earth's surface.
:a part of a whole :portion A large percent [=(more commonly) percentage] of their profits comes from online sales.

utxt.vi: I'm 99.9 percent sure that I am right. [=I am almost completely sure that I am right]
I agree with her 100 percent. [=I agree with her completely]
He feels 100 percent better. [=he feels completely healthy again]
I received a five percent [=5%] increase in my salary.

def.dt: :having the color of blood a shiny red fire truck bright red shoes dark red apples
:reddish brown or reddish orange in color She has red hair. [=she is a redhead] a red fox
:pink because of embarrassment, anger, etc. His face turns red when he gets angry. When she realized her mistake, she turned beet red. [=she blushed] (Brit) His face went red with embarrassment.
:having many red lines from lack of sleep, drunkenness, etc. :bloodshot Her eyes were red from crying.

dro.dre: a red rag to a bull

def.dt: :something that makes a person very angry Just mentioning his poor marks to him was waving a red rag to a bull.

utxt.vi: There was swelling and redness around the site of the bee sting.
